line_1: And carried a' the gree awa'.
line_2: The blithest lad that e'er I saw;

line_1: That stole, a while, her heart awa' .
And he has been sae lang awa' !
line_2: To drive the dourness frae us a'!
To bid God bless them a'!
He lik'd the best of a',
Your skill in love's but sma;

line_1: Forby sax mae, I've sell't awa,
line_2: My Pleugh is now thy bairn-time a';

line_1: Forby sax mae, I've sell't awa,
line_2: Four gallant brutes, as e'er did draw;

line_1: Forby sax mae, I've sell't awa,
line_2: They drew me thretteen pund an' twa,

line_1: I'll mind you still, tho' far awa.
Those happy scenes when far awa!
line_2: Which none but Craftsmen ever saw!

line_1: Shall be my Pray'r when far awa,
line_2: Still rising by the plummet's law,

line_1: To him, the Bard, that's far awa.
